name: Abs
description: Returns the absolute value of a specified number.

name: Acos
description: Returns the angle whose cosine is the specified number.

name: Asin
description: Returns the angle whose sine is the specified number.

name: Atan
description: Returns the angle whose tangent is the specified number.

name: Atn2
description: Returns the angle whose tangent is the quotient of two specified numbers.

name: Ceiling
description: Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to the specified number.

name: Cos
description: Returns the cosine of the specified angle.

name: Cot
description: Returns the trigonometric cotangent of the specified angle, in radians, in the specified float expression.

name: Degrees
description: Returns the corresponding angle in degrees for an angle specified in radians.

name: Exp
description: Returns e raised to the specified power.

name: Floor
description: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the specified decimal number.

name: Log
description: Returns the natural (base e or base user-specified) logarithm of a specified number.

name: Log10
description: Returns the base 10 logarithm of a specified number.

name: PI
description: Represents the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter, specified by the constant, π.

name: Power
description: Returns a specified number raised to the specified power.

name: Radians
description: Returns radians when a numeric expression, in degrees, is entered.

name: Rand
description: Returns a random integer that is within a specified range,
Or returns a random floating-point number that is greater than or equal to 0.0, and less than 1.0.

name: Round
description: Rounds a value to the nearest integer or to the specified number of fractional digits.
Available MidpointRounding enumeration values: ToEven, AwayFromZero.

name: Sign
description: Returns an integer that indicates the sign of a number.
-1: value is less than zero.
0: value is equal to zero.
1: value is greater than zero.

name: Sin
description: Returns the sine of the specified angle.

name: Sqrt
description: Returns the square root of a specified number.

name: Square
description: Returns the square of a specified number.

name: Tan
description: Returns the tangent of the specified angle.

name: DateAdd
description: Adds a specified number value (as a signed integer) to a specified datepart of an input date value, and then returns that modified value.
Available EDatePart enumeration values:
Year, yyyy, yy,
Quarter, qq, q,
Month, mm, m,
DayOfYear, dy, y
Day, dd, d,
WeekDay, dw,
Week, ww, wk,
Hour, hh,
Minute, mi, n,
Second, ss, s,
MilliSecond, ms

name: DateDiff
description: Returns the count (as a signed integer value) of the specified datepart boundaries crossed between the specified startdate and enddate.
Available EDatePart enumeration values:
Year, yyyy, yy,
Quarter, qq, q,
Month, mm, m,
DayOfYear, dy, y
Day, dd, d,
WeekDay, dw,
Week, ww, wk,
Hour, hh,
Minute, mi, n,
Second, ss, s,
MilliSecond, ms

name: DateFromParts
description: Returns a date value that maps to the specified year, month, and day values.

name: DatePart
description: Returns an integer representing the specified datepart of the specified date.
Available EDatePart enumeration values:
Year, yyyy, yy,
Quarter, qq, q,
Month, mm, m,
DayOfYear, dy, y
Day, dd, d,
WeekDay, dw,
Week, ww, wk,
Hour, hh,
Minute, mi, n,
Second, ss, s,
MilliSecond, ms

name: EOMonth
description: Returns the last day of the month containing a specified date, with an optional offset.

name: GetDate
description: Returns the current system timestamp as a datetime value without the time zone offset.

name: GetUtcDate
description: Returns the current system timestamp as a UTC datetime value without the time zone offset.

name: Concat
description: Concatenates several strings together.

name: Format
description: Formats the given value to a string using the given format.

name: IndexOf
description: Gets the location of a substring in a string, starting from the beginning or specified position.

name: IsNull
description: Checks if the given value is null or DBNull;
Or gets an alternative value if the first value is null or DBNull.

name: Left
description: Gets the substring from the given string (starting from left)

name: Len
description: Gets the length of the given string.

name: Lower
description: Converts all the characters in the given string to lower case.

name: LTrim
description: Remove all the leading spaces from the given string.

name: Replace
description: Replace a sequence of characters in the given string with another set of characters.

name: Replicate
description: Repeats the given string a specified number of times.

name: Reverse
description: Reverses the given string.

name: Right
description: Gets the substring from given string (starting from right).

name: RTrim
description: Remove all the trailing spaces from the given string.

name: SubString
description: Extracts a substring from the given string.

name: ToString
description: Returns a string that represents the given object.

name: Trim
description: Remove all the leading and trailing spaces from the given string.

name: Upper
description: Converts all the characters in the given string to upper case.

name: Array
description: Creates an array with given objects.

name: Category
syntax: Category(value, RangeOption rangeOption, OutsideRangeOption outsideRangeOption, min, max, step)
description: Gets a text representing the range that the specified value is in.
Available RangeOption enumeration values: IncludeLeft_ExcludeRight, ExcludeLeft_IncludeRight.
Available OutsideRangeOption enumeration values: None, LessThanMin, GreaterThanMax, All

name: CustomCategory
description: Gets a text repr esenting the range that the specified value is in.
Available RangeOption enumeration values: IncludeLeft_ExcludeRight, ExcludeLeft_IncludeRight.

name: FiscalYear
description: Gets the fiscal year of specified date.

name: FiscalMonth
description: Gets the fiscal month of specified date.

name: FiscalQuarter
description: Gets the fiscal quarter of specified date.

name: Asc
description: Returns an Integer value representing the character code corresponding to a character.

name: AscW
description: Returns an Integer value representing the character code corresponding to a Unicode character.

name: Chr
description: Returns the character associated with the specified character code.

name: ChrW
description: Returns the Unicode character associated with the specified character code.

name: Filter
syntax: Filter([source1,source2...], Match, [bool Include = True], [CompareMethod Compare = Binary])
description: Returns a zero-based array containing a subset of a String array based on specified filter criteria.
Available CompareMethod enumeration values: Binary, Text.

name: FormatCurrency
syntax: FormatCurrency(expression, [int NumDigitsAfterDecimal = -1], [TriState IncludeLeadingDigit = UseDefault], [TriState UseParensForNegativeNumbers = UseDefault], [TriState GroupDigits = UseDefault])
description: Returns an expression formatted as a currency value using the currency symbol defined in the system control panel.
Available TriState enumeration values: True, False, UseDefault.

name: FormatDateTime
description: Returns a string expression representing a date/time value.
Available DateFormat enumeration values: GeneralDate, LongDate, ShortDate, LongTime, ShortTime.

name: FormatNumber
syntax: FormatNumber(expression, [int NumDigitsAfterDecimal = -1], [TriState IncludeLeadingDigit = UseDefault], [TriState UseParensForNegativeNumbers = UseDefault], [TriState GroupDigits = UseDefault])
description: Returns an expression formatted as a number.
Available TriState enumeration values: True, False, UseDefault.

name: FormatPercent
syntax: FormatPercent(expression, numDigitsAfterDecimal = -1, TriState includeLeadingDigit = UseDefault, TriState useParensForNegativeNumbers = UseDefault, TriState groupDigits = TriState.UseDefault)
description: Returns an expression formatted as a percentage (that is, multiplied by 100) with a trailing % character.
Available TriState enumeration values: True, False, UseDefault.

name: GetChar
description: Returns a Char value representing the character from the specified index in the supplied string.

name: InStr
description: Returns an integer specifying the start position of the first occurrence of one string within another.
Available CompareMethod enumeration values: Binary, Text.

name: InStrRev
description: Returns the position of the first occurrence of one string within another, starting from the right side of the string.
Available CompareMethod enumeration values: Binary, Text.

name: Join
description: Returns a string created by joining a number of substrings contained in an array.

name: LCase
description: Returns a string or character converted to lowercase.

name: LSet
description: Returns a left-aligned string containing the specified string adjusted to the specified length.

name: Mid
description: Returns a string containing a specified number of characters from a string.

name: RSet
description: Returns a right-aligned string containing the specified string adjusted to the specified length.

name: Space
description: Returns a string consisting of the specified number of spaces.

name: Split
description: Returns a zero-based, one-dimensional array containing a specified number of substrings.

name: StrComp
description: Returns -1, 0, or 1, based on the result of a string comparison.

name: StrDup
description: Returns a string or object consisting of the specified character repeated the specified number of times.

name: StrReverse
description: Returns a string in which the character order of a specified string is reversed.

name: UCase
description: Returns a string or character containing the specified string converted to uppercase.

name: StrLike
description: Compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like operator.
Available CompareMethod enumeration values: Binary, Text.

name: StrLikeText
description: Compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like operator, using text comparison.

name: StrLikeBinary
description: Compares the parameters Source and Pattern and returns the same results as the Like operator, using binary comparison.

name: DateSerial
description: Returns a Date value representing a specified year, month, and day.

name: DateString
description: Returns a String value representing the current date according to your system.

name: DateValue
description: Returns a Date value containing the date information represented by a string, with the time information set to midnight (00:00:00).

name: Day
description: Returns an Integer value from 1 through 31 representing the day of the month.

name: Hour
description: Returns an Integer value from 0 through 23 representing the hour of the day.

name: Minute
description: Returns an Integer value from 0 through 59 representing the minute of the hour.

name: Month
description: Returns an Integer value from 1 through 12 representing the month of the year

name: MonthName
description: Returns a String value containing the name of the specified month.

name: Now
description: Returns a Date value containing the current date and time according to your system.

name: Second
description: Returns an Integer value from 0 through 59 representing the second of the minute.

name: TimeOfDay
description: Returns or sets a Date value containing the current time of day according to your system.

name: Timer
description: Returns a Double value representing the number of seconds elapsed since midnight.

name: TimeSerial
description: Returns a Date value representing a specified hour, minute, and second, with the date information set relative to January 1 of the year 1.

name: TimeString
description: Returns or sets a String value representing the current time of day according to your system.

name: TimeValue
description: Returns a Date value containing the time information represented by a string, with the date information set to January 1 of the year 1.

name: Today
description: Returns or sets a Date value containing the current date according to your system.

name: Weekday
description: Returns an Integer value containing a number representing the day of the week.
Available FirstDayOfWeek enumeration values: System, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.

name: WeekdayName
description: Returns a String value containing the name of the specified weekday.
Available FirstDayOfWeek enumeration values: System, Sunday, Monday,Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.

name: Year
description: Returns an Integer value from 1 through 9999 representing the year.

name: CBool
description: Converts given value to 'bool' type.

name: CByte
description: Converts given value to 'byte' type.

name: CChar
description: Converts given value to 'char' type.

name: CDate
description: Converts given value to 'DateTime' type.

name: CDbl
description: Converts given value to 'double' type.

name: CDec
description: Converts given value to 'decimal' type.

name: CInt
description: Converts given value to 'int' type.

name: CLng
description: Converts given value to 'long' type.

name: CShort
description: Converts given value to 'short' type.

name: CSng
description: Converts given value to 'float' type.

name: CStr
description: Converts given value to 'string' type.

name: Fix
description: Return the integer portion of a number.
Differences between Int and Fix: Int converts -8.4 to -9, Fix converts -8.4 to -8.

name: Hex
description: Returns a string representing the hexadecimal value of a number.

name: Int
description: Return the integer portion of a number.
Differences between Int and Fix: Int converts -8.4 to -9, Fix converts -8.4 to -8.

name: Oct
description: Returns a string representing the octal value of a number.

name: Str
description: Returns a String representation of a number.
A leading space is always reserved for the sign of number.

name: Val
description: Returns the numbers contained in a string as a numeric value of appropriate type.

name: Rnd
description: Returns a random number of type Single.

name: Choose
description: Returns a value from the list of choices based on the value of index.
If index is 1, Choose returns the first choice in the list; if index is 2, it returns the second choice, and so on.
Syntax: Choose(index, choice-1 [, choice-2, ... [, choice-n ]] )

name: IIF
description: Returns one of two objects, depending on the evaluation of an expression.

name: Switch
description: Evaluates a list of expressions and returns a value or an expression associated with the first expression in the list that is True.
Syntax: Switch(expr-1, value-1 [ ,expr-2,value-2… [ ,expr-n,value-n ]] )

name: Partition
description: Returns a string indicating where a number occurs within a calculated series of ranges.
You can create a select query that shows how many orders fall within various ranges, for example, order values from 1 to 1000, 1001 to 2000, and so on.

name: IsArray
description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a variable is an array.

name: IsDate
description: Returns True if the expression is a date or is recognizable as a valid date or time.

name: IsNothing
description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an expression has no object assigned to it.

name: IsNumeric
description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an expression can be evaluated as a number.

name: IsError
description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an expression can be evaluated as an error (exception).

name: IsDBNull
description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an object is null value or DBNull.

name: DDB
description: Returns a Double specifying the depreciation of an asset for a specific time period using the double-declining balance method or some other method you specify.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/ddb-function for details.

name: FV
syntax: FV(Rate, NPer, Pmt, [double PV = 0.0], [DueDate Due = EndOfPeriod])
description: Returns a Double specifying the future value of an annuity based on periodic, fixed payments and a fixed interest rate.
Available DueDate enumeration values: EndOfPeriod, BegOfPeriod.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/fv-function for details.

name: IPMT
syntax: IPmt(Rate, Per, NPer, PV, [double FV = 0.0], [DueDate Due = EndOfPeriod])
description: Returns a Double specifying the interest payment for a given period of an annuity based on periodic, fixed payments and a fixed interest rate.
Available DueDate enumeration values: EndOfPeriod, BegOfPeriod.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/ipmt-function for details.

name: NPER
syntax: NPer(Rate, Pmt, PV, [double FV = 0.0], [DueDate Due = EndOfPeriod])
description: Returns a Double specifying the number of periods for an annuity based on periodic, fixed payments and a fixed interest rate.
Available DueDate enumeration values: EndOfPeriod, BegOfPeriod.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/nper-function for details.

name: PMT
syntax: Pmt(Rate, NPer, PV, [double FV = 0.0], [DueDate Due = EndOfPeriod)]
description: Returns a Double specifying the payment for an annuity based on periodic, fixed payments and a fixed interest rate.
Available DueDate enumeration values: EndOfPeriod, BegOfPeriod.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/pmt-function for details.

name: PPMT
syntax: PPmt(Rate, Per, NPer, PV, [double FV = 0.0], [DueDate Due = EndOfPeriod])
description: Returns a Double specifying the principal payment for a given period of an annuity based on periodic, fixed payments and a fixed interest rate.
Available DueDate enumeration values: EndOfPeriod, BegOfPeriod.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/ppmt-function for details.

name: PV
syntax: PV(Rate, NPer, Pmt, [double FV = 0.0], [DueDate Due = EndOfPeriod])
description: Returns a Double specifying the present value of an annuity based on periodic, fixed payments to be paid in the future and a fixed interest rate.
Available DueDate enumeration values: EndOfPeriod, BegOfPeriod.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/pv-function for details.

name: RATE
syntax: Rate(NPer, Pmt, PV, [double FV = 0.0], [DueDate Due = EndOfPeriod], [double Guess = 0.1])
description: Returns a Double specifying the interest rate per period for an annuity.
Available DueDate enumeration values: EndOfPeriod, BegOfPeriod.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/rate-function for details.

name: SLN
description: Returns a Double specifying the straight-line depreciation of an asset for a single period.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/sln-function for details.

name: SYD
description: Returns a Double specifying the sum-of-years' digits depreciation of an asset for a specified period.
See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vba/language-reference-vba/articles/syd-function for details.
